Text: Boy, Ratburn's tough! He gave us homework on the first day.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Get with it, Arthur. We're not dealing with a human being here. This is serious!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You find it yet?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: Hello, this is Mr. Ratburn.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Shhh!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Uh-oh.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: Yes, I have all the eyes I need, but I'm completely out of heads. I need heads. I can wait for girls' heads, but I must have boys' heads immediately.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Wait, he'll see us! And we have... boys' heads!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: There's no time! I need them now. I'll have to get them myself. [hangs up]

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: What are you doing?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Ratburn. He—He's looking for body parts—heads! Boys' heads!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: You must have heard wrong. A vampire doesn't need heads.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: This is no ordinary vampire.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: He's beyond vampire.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: What's beyond a vampire?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: A Ratburn!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey! What—

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Stand still. He wants boy heads, not girls'.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Breakfast!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: What do you think he's gonna do with that saw?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: I read a book where kids discovered a scary mystery like this and became detectives to solve it.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: We should probably investigate.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You know, we have a lot of homework to do.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: You're just a fraidy-cat.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur, we have to chose: face horrifying, scary danger or do our homework.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine and Arthur:
Text: Horrifying, scary danger.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: I'm bored. He's not doing anything weird. You probably heard him talking about heads of lettuce.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Boy heads of lettuce? I don't think so, Francine.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Francine:
Text: Oh, yeah? It's probably the term grocers use for the rotten ones. I'm gonna do my homework.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur, look!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: [afraid] M-Maybe we should go do our homework.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Come on.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: He went into the carnival.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Of course he went into the carnival. Look at all those boy heads!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: We've got to warn them.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Oh, no! He's got us! We're trapped!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Look! There he goes! Come on! He went into that booth.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Okay, it was that one.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: This is very authentic, Mrs. MacGrady, but I'd prefer a real action pose.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Sorry, sir.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Okay, I pick this time.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur and Buster:
Text: One... two... three... go!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Run away!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: You're not safe! He'll get you!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: [as Jack] Hey, you're not in this story.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Puppet radio:
Text: And you're doing my lines! I warn Jack to run away, but not till he hears "Fee-fi-fo—" you know the drill.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: Arthur, Buster, get off the stage! [in Jack's voice] Okay, fellas, when you leave that castle, make a left, down that beanstalk, and you'll be back in Elwood City.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Wow! The Rat does kids' puppet shows?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Puppet radio:
Text: Jack, you're disorganized. You'd forget your head if it wasn't attached.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: [as Jack] Uh-uh! Would not!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Puppet radio:
Text: Grab your head and hide! Here comes the giant!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur, look!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Giant:
Text: Fee-fi-fo-fum!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Audience:
Text: Ew! Gross!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: [inspecting his damaged puppet head] They always crack when I do that. I must go through 50 boy heads a year.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur and Buster:
Text: Boy heads!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: I can never have enough boy heads.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: We didn't know you made puppets.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: [reassembling a head for Jack] Can't talk, boys—I have 40 seconds to get Jack ready. Must always stay on schedule because of all I do.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You do a lot! You're a teacher, a coach, you work on the school paper... [laughs] I can't even find time to do my homework and eat!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: You need to learn to organize your time. I've heard that some people think I give a lot of homework.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur and Buster:
Text: We never heard that.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: But once you've learned good work habits, you'll discover—

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Puppet radio:
Text: Jack! Where are you?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: [as Jack] Just a second! The cat rolled my head into the litter box. [to Arthur and Buster] You're capable of more than you think. I'll teach you how to do that homework and then have more time for things you enjoy.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Like how you do all that stuff plus puppets?

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: Exactly. [checks watch] Ah! Two seconds early. Self-discipline is as important to learn as two plus two. [as Jack] Okay, I got my head on straight! [goes back on stage with Jack's head backwards]

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Puppet radio:
Text: Hey, man, your head's on straight, but your body is backwards!

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: Please don't stand there. I have to concentrate on my work.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh. Sorry. [to Buster] Boy, were we wrong.

Episode Name: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Transcript
Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: By the way, boys, I can't wait to see your Geography projects tomorrow.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Do you think everybody gets nervous before they do something that's really important to them?

Speaker: Francine ):
Text: Benjamin, do you think you should do this?

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: I have to. (Lightning zaps the kite) Ouch! Ouch! I did it! Ouch! Ouch! Ouch! Heyyy! Ouch!

Speaker: Herbert Haney:
Text: And next, Arthur Read.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Yay! Yahoo! Yeah, Arthur!

Speaker: Arthur, Francine, and Prunella:
Text: Good morning, Mr. Haney.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: The All-school Spellathon is coming up. Everybody ready to compete?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Well, the third grade has the best spellers.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: It used to, but now I'm in the fourth grade. I won last year with the word "endurance". Can you spell "endurance", Arthur?

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Forget it.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: It's a good thing the third grade isn't depending on ME to win.

Speaker: Nigel Ratburn:
Text: Quiet, please. Everyone, get your homework out, so I can collect it. An important announcement, people: on Friday, we will have a spelling test.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: It will be a spell-off in Spellathon style. Study very hard, because the winners get a special surprise.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What do you think the surprise is?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Maybe the winner doesn't have to do so much homework for the rest of the year.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: If it means less homework, I want to win. I'm going to study extra-hard.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Me, too.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Oh! I knew I forgot something. There. Now I can really concentrate.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: A-N-T-I-D... Er...

Speaker: Mr. Powers:
Text: What word are you struggling with, son?

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Antidisestablishmentarianism. I can never remember if it has five I's or six.

Speaker: Mr. Powers:
Text: Maybe you should just skip down to "antidote".

Speaker: Computer:
Text: Dog.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: D-O-G.

Speaker: Computer:
Text: Muffy...you're...a...genius.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) Hey! That's it!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: This oughta do it.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Dad, listen to this! this song fits the letters of the first word on my spelling list. He turns on a tape recorder and does a kind of hip-hop dance. A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K...

Speaker: Arthur and David Read ):
Text: A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K! A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K! A-A-R-D...

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: V-A-R-K!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Don't bother me D.W., I'm studying!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Oh, is *that* what you call it! I thought you had ants in your pants.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Go away.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: All right. What a grouch...

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K! A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Huh?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, hi, Buster! Done studying already?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Don't have to. I have this. My good luck C-H-A-R-M - charm. Wanna go to the arcade?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I should probably study some more.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: If you know it now, is one more hour really gonna help?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Maybe you're right. It doesn't feel like I'm getting any better at it.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Face it, pal, some people are born spellers. You're more the..."go have fun" type. They've got the jet game that flips you upside down.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You ready for the test, Arthur?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: The test!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: How long did you study? I woke up extra early to squeeze in more study time. I know this whole book, even the publisher's address.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Buster and I went to the arcade and I forgot to finish studying.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Okay, everyone. Line up for the spelling bee.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: That is incorrect. You may sit down. Jenna, please spell "essential".

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: What am I gonna do, what am I gonna do?! Maybe if I lean against the heater, maybe my temperature will go up and I can go to the nurse!

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Arthur, perhaps you can be the first not to get knocked out by this word: "Aardvark".

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: A-A-R-D-V-A-R-K!

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Thank you for the entertainment, Arthur. Francine, spell "pleasant".

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Pleasant - P-L-E-A-S-E-N-T.

Speaker: Ratburn:
Text: No, I'm sorry.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What kind of stupid word is that? Pleasant...

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Arthur and the Brain are our winners! And the surprise you've won is, you will represent our class in the All-school Spellathon.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Mr. Ratburn, I don't think I should be in the Spellathon.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: You earned the honor, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Yeah, but the thing is, I don't know how to spell anything. A-N-T-I-N-G. See? I just knew that one word.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Did you study?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Sort of. N-No. Not really.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: It's going to take some study, Arthur, but if you really work at it, I know you can do well at the Spellathon.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You do?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: And Mr. Ratburn thinks I can do it. I have a lot of studying to do. I have a list of a 100 words to learn.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: That's only 92 more than you know now.

Speaker: Jane Read:
Text: D.W.! We'll all be happy to help any way we can, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: E-L-E-P-H-A-N-T - elephant.

Speaker: Jane Read:
Text: D.W.!

Speaker: Jane Read:
Text: How about some ice cream?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: ): Are you bribing me?

Speaker: Jane Read:
Text: ): Yes.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: ): Okay.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Hey, Arthur! You wanna play football?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I have to study. S-O-R-R-Y.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Sour?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Sorry!

Speaker: Baby Kate:
Text: Nuhh! Nuhh! Nuhh! Nuhh! [GURGLES]

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: My brain hurts. All this studying isn't helping me at all! I'm just not a speller.

Speaker: David Read:
Text: Sometimes it feels like you're not getting it when you actually are. You want a snack?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Absolutely! A-B-S-O-L-U-T-E-L-Y - absolutely. He runs out, then comes back and checks the book. Hey! That's right!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I got it!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hi, D.W. Is Arthur there?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Sorry, Arthur can't come out to play. He's exercising his brain. But I'm available. I'm not a prisoner of MY vocabulary.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Hi, Arthur!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hey, Brain! How's the studying going?

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Extraordinarily well! Now I'm getting some equipment for the computer program I'm writing in my spare time!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: *Spare* time?!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Spell "toothpaste".

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Toothpaste. T-O-O-T-H-P-A-S-T-E - toothpaste. Right?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: How should I know?

Speaker: Baby Kate:
Text: ) Glooba!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Glooba. G-L-O-O-B-A - glooba.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I'm nervous. N-E-R-V-O-U-S - nervous.

Speaker: Thora Read:
Text: You'll do just fine, Arthur.

Speaker: Mrs. Read:
Text: You'd better get backstage. We'll sit down. Good luck!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Don't worry. If you lose, I bet Mom and Dad will let you live in the garage.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Today's the big day. How do you feel?

Speaker: Brain:
Text: I feel fine!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I wish I were back in bed.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: It's starting! They're gonna light the Spellathon torch. It's so exciting!

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Welcome to the All-School Spellathon. And now, our contestants.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Go, Arthur!

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Everybody ready? Good luck. Our first word goes to...the Brain. Brain walks to the microphone sweating nervously. Spell "fear". Brain seems frozen. Brain?

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Brain, spell "fear".

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Fear. F-E-R-E - fear.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: I'm sorry. That's incorrect.

Speaker: Audience:
Text: Aw.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Are you sure? What dictionary are you using?

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Spell "pieces".

Speaker: Third-Grade Cat:
Text: Pieces. P-E-I-C-E-S - pieces.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: No, I'm sorry.

Speaker: Audience:
Text: Aw.

Speaker: Third-Grade Cat:
Text: I before E except after C, I before E except after C...

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: The word is "champion".

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: That's so easy. I see it every day on my award from last year. Champion. C-H-A-M-P-I-O-N - champion.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Arthur, spell "suggest".

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Suggest. S-U-G-G-E-S-T - suggest.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: That is correct.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: You can't beat me! Why don't you just give up?!

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Prunella, spell "preparation". Prunella pauses. She and the audience look stunned. Prunella?

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Could I have a definition, please?

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Preparation – the process of getting ready.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Of course. Preparation. P-R-E-P... ) ...E...R-A-T-I-O-N - preparation.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: I'm sorry, that's incorrect.

Speaker: Audience:
Text: Aw.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Now Arthur gets a chance. If you spell this correctly, Arthur, you are the winner. "Preparation".

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Preparation. P-R-E-P-A-R-A-T-I-O-N - preparation.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Absolutely marvelous...

Speaker: Buster:
Text: That was the most fantastic thing I've ever seen! Arthur, you're the greatest speller of all time.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You know what the best part of winning is? It's over!

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Congratulations, Arthur! I knew you could do it!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Yeah, but now HE knows he could do it.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I don't want to go to the lake! Put me down! No! Nooooo! Let me gooooo! [screams and cries]

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Sorry about this. D.W.'s been acting a little weird lately.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: What do you mean "lately"? She's always weird.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I meant more than usual—ever since that day she went to the aquarium with her play group.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Arthur, save me! [takes his glasses and continues wailing and sobbing]

Text: Arthur and Super Sister

Speaker: Announcer:
Text: Welcome to the aquarium.

Speaker: Announcer:
Text: Any questions?

Text: Uh, where do they go to the bathroom?

Speaker: Announcer:
Text: In the water, where they live.

Text: [some laugh] Ew! Yuck!

Text: Now, before you go, be sure and visit our Hall of Sea Monsters, especially... the shark!

Text: Speaking of bathrooms...

Text: Hey, look at this! It flushes by itself!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: When do we see the shark?

Speaker: Ms. Morgan:
Text: Soon. Hurry up, kids! You don't want to spend the whole day in the bathroom!

Speaker: Preschoolers:
Text: Yes, we do!

Speaker: Sarah:
Text: The bathroom is fun!

Speaker: Speaker:
Text: Attention, please. Don't miss the Hall of Sea Monsters, home of the most monstrous monsters in the world! Prepare to lose your mind with fear!

Text: Don't be scared. It's only an eel.

Text: Look, it's a shark!

Speaker: Tommy:
Text: Oh, no! Did you hear that?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: [laughs]

Text: Hey, look! An octopus!

Text: What's an octopu—?

Text: And then I hit it on the nose.

Text: With what?

Text: Uh... a stick! And then I pulled my leg out of its mouth.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: The octopus got your leg?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Yes! That's what I'm trying to tell you!

Text: Honey, why don't you save your story for later? It's almost time for bed. [[[Pal]] is licking her leg.] Hey, that tickles!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Anyway, I bet you were scared. I bet you ran away.

Text: Did not!

Text: And the eensy-beentsy spider went up the Brussels sprout. Down— [turns toward the door suddenly] [quietly] Down came the rain and... [looks up the faucet]

Text: OCTOPUS! [dangles a fake spider on a string in front of D.W.]

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: [screams] Octopus! Octopus! OCTOPUS! [runs out of the bathroom into her mom's closet. Mrs. Read is reading on the bed.]

Speaker: Jane:
Text: What the—?!

Speaker: David:
Text: And...?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: And I'm really sorry. It was just a joke.

Speaker: Jane:
Text: Not a very funny one. Now go to your room.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: And don't come out until I say so.

Speaker: Jane:
Text: Feel better?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: [grudgingly] I hope an octopus eats him.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hello?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You've got air conditioning, right?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: In my dad's kitchen.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Be right over.

Text: All right! Let's go! [sets down soccer ball] He runs, he kicks... score!

Text: [clears throat]

Speaker: Buster:

Text: [to Arthur] You're in big trouble now.

Text: [angrily] That's it. I've had it.

Text: Had what?

Text: You're right. I can't take it anymore.

Text: Now you're in really big trouble.

Text: No, she means we just can't take the heat, so we'll just have to... go to Bear Lake!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: [gasps]

Text: I'm not going.

Speaker: Others:
Text: What? Why?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I don't want to go in the water.

Speaker: Arthur:

Text: It was much hotter. There were a lot of ferns. And different insects. And even--dinosaurs!

Text: Thank you. Now usually, the bodies would rot away. But very, very rarely, the hard parts of the bodies like shells and bones would last.

Speaker: Ranger Ruth:
Text: Many years later, this whole area was covered by the sea. Over millions of years, the soil turned to rock, and the bones and shells turned to rock too. Then the sea dried up, and a hundred million years later, the result is--

Text: Maybe it seemed that way, honey, but maybe Muffy's just not used to living in a house with different rules. It might be a good thing for you two to talk about it in school tomorrow.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I hope she doesn't sneeze to death before then.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Muffy?

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Francine. I wanted to tell you I'm sorry I was so rude. I really did like staying at your house.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Aren't you going to take your limo?

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: I decided to walk with you today.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Really? You sure you aren't gonna to faint or something?

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: I'm having Bailey follow. The limousine follows the girls. I even started to miss leftovers. The hotel wouldn't make them for me. Francine, do you think...?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What?

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Mumsie says the carpet's almost out, but... do you think I could stay one last night with you?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Well, if you think you can survive with just three TV channels.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Of course. If I can survive walking all the way to school, I can survive anything!

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: I'm serious! Are we there yet?! How much farther? I think I have a blister!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Is there any way to separate D.W. from her Blankie? She brings it with her everywhere...

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: ...to daycare...

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Hm...

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: ...to the amusement park...

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Hold on! Woo!

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: ...even in the bathtub. And it never gets washed!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Everywhere she goes, she's just gotta have that smelly old blankie.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Come on!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: And that's why I'm spending my entire Saturday running all over town with her.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Move it, Arthur!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Yoo-hoo! She feels in Kate’s crib. )

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hello? Buster? D.W. runs into him and he drops the phone. Ohh!

Speaker: Buster ):
Text: Arthur? Are you still there?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: D.W.!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: My blankie's missing!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Big whoop. He picks up the phone under the table. Buster? Sorry, I got D.W.ed. Really?! You rented all the Renegade Joe movies?! Cool! I'm on my way!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Arthur! My blankie! I can't find it!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Well, we know it's not in the washing machine. Ask Mom where it is.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: She went to work and won't be home till late.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: You took it, didn't you?! Where's my blankie, you pathetic excuse for a dog?!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: He didn't take your germy blankie! Pal's got better taste than that!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Prove it! Help me find it!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I'm going to Buster's. Find your own blankie!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: When I'm asking all your friends if they've seen my blankie, I'm sure the subject of who sleeps with teddy bears will come up.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Huh? )

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Okay, let's just make it quick. Where did you have it last?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Well, Mom had to give some papers to Mrs. Tibble. She stops. The Tibble Twins! That's it! Arthur, they stole my blankie!

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: When we were leaving, they probably slid down the bannister...

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: ...and grabbed my blankie!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: How could they do that without you and Mom seeing them?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: You're right, Arthur.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Mrs. Tibble must've thrown magic dust on us!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Magic dust?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: ) Come on, Arthur, before they do something terrible with it!

Speaker: Mrs. Tibble:
Text: The twins? No, Arthur. They've been off with Trixie all weekend. But, when they come back, I'll tell them you want to play with them!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: No! See, I didn't... Oh, great! Now, I'm gonna have to play with those two little monsters!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Arthur! I just remembered where my blankie must be! Come on!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: When we were at the dry cleaners...

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: ...I must've got hypnotized looking at the clothes on the rack whirling around and around. There are spirals in D.W.’s eyes. Then, while Mom was paying, the machine ordered me to hand over my blankie.

Speaker: Lady:
Text: Hypnotized? That's the funniest thing I've ever heard! Oh, aren't you just the cutest little girl!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: But, what about my blankie...

Speaker: Lady:
Text: Such a cute little girl! Goochee goochee goo.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I can't believe she thought you were cute!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I am cute! I'm adorable! Duh!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Come on! I gotta get to Buster's. Where next?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Wait a minute. Now I remember! The library! That's where it happened!

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: My blankie must have gotten caught in one of them. And when the books went in the slot, my blankie went with them. The blankie disappears. D.W. waves to Miss Turner who is stamping books. And I didn't notice because I was waving to Miss Turner. She’s nice.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Well, I hope you're right, so I can catch the end of Renegade Joe.

Speaker: Miss Turner:
Text: I'm sorry, D.W. I looked everywhere and didn't see a blankie. However, if you check the card catalogue, you may find a book about blankies.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Come on.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh no, Binky Barnes. I don't want him to know I'm looking for a blankie.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Oh no, it's Arthur. I don't want him to know I'm reading books.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Arthur, that's it! I must have lost it at the car wash.

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: We were going though and I felt like I was in a giant dishwasher. Water was dripping on me, because I'd left the window open a little bit. Then that scary giant vacuum cleaner came down and I shut my eyes.

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: And while I had my eyes closed, it must have sucked my blankie right out the window.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: It's so simple!

Speaker: Man:
Text: I'm sorry, it only sucks up water, not blankies. But you can have my polishing cloth.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: It's not dirty enough for her.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Well, this is the last place we went. I guess, maybe after we ate our ice-cream...

Speaker: D.W. ):
Text: ...I left my blankie at the table.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: That's it??

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I'm too tired to think of anything. Come on.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, no! We can't go in there! I don't want all those girls to know I'm looking for a blankie! The door closes behind D.W. )

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Arthur! Over here!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Girls:
Text: Hi, Arthur.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Sit with us, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Er-er-er... no, thanks. I'm just here getting D.W. some ice cream. )

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: What is she doing?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, some make-believe game. You know how little kids are. )

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Yes, they can be so immature.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, well, er... gotta go. Bye!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: We can go. They don't have it.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Have what?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: My bl...

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Favorite flavor. They don't have her favorite flavor. Okay, let's go. Now!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What's her favorite flavor?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Er... Chocolate... vanilla...chip...blankie! The girls stare at him. Okay, bye!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: But we haven't found my blankie yet!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I don't care about your blankie! I'm going to Buster's!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Sorry, Arthur, my mom returned them. But they were great! In this one, Renegade Joe takes on these flying gorillas that are trying to rule the Earth. But Joe infiltrates them by wearing a flying gorilla suit and he gets into their secret hideout in this cave hundreds of feet below the surface of the Earth... Oh, it was so cool! I can't believe you missed it!

Speaker: Mr. Read:
Text: Well, good night, pumpkin.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: But, Daddy, how am I supposed to sleep without my blankie?!

Speaker: Mr. Read:
Text: Sweetie, I know you really miss your blankie. And I promise we'll look for it first thing in the morning. But now it's really time for you to go to sleep.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Give it back! Give it back!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: D.W.?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I want my blankie. Give me my blankie!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hey, D.W.! Wake up, you're dreaming!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Oh... Arthur! Arthur, I'm so worried. My poor blankie's lost all alone without anybody to tuck it in!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I'm sure it'll be okay for one night, D.W.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: You're mean, Arthur! It's not gonna be okay for one night.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Wait a minute! I think I have an idea!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: D.W., would Stanley help?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: It's not the same thing! Duh! Pal brings her a red blankie. Get away from me, Pal! I don't want that! I want my blankie! Understand?! My blankie! Nobody understands!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: But, D.W., this is your blankie!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: ) Is not! For one thing, it doesn't smell anything like my blankie. It smells...

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Clean?

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Hey, it did used to be red and white, didn't it! It is you! Oh, Blankie, you're safe!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: It was right there the whole time. Mom must've washed it. I guess you owe Pal an apology.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: I, er... I guess I'm sorry. Are you okay, Blankie?! I was so worried about you!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Come on, Pal!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Arthur! Blankie says thank you for helping me look for her.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Okay, good night, D.W.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) That dumb Blankie. He turns around. (mumbles) Suddenly, he starts searching the bed and the room. Stanley? Oh no!

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Looking for something? You left this in my room, but I'm sure you don't need him.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Bring that back, D.W.! Dad!! D.W., give it back to me! I'm telling Dad, D.W.! Hey, Dad, D.W. won't give me back Stanley!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Our homework for tonight is to read all there is to know about how clouds form. Miss Sweetwater's class is studying clouds too. But their homework is to just look at some clouds.

Speaker: 3rd Grade Male Dog:
Text: ) It looks like a bunny.

Speaker: Mary:
Text: Yeah. It's so cute.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) That's because our teacher, Mr. Ratburn, is the toughest teacher on Earth.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: He turns everything into schoolwork. Even a field trip to the zoo.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Francine, what is the average lifespan of a Galapagos Turtle?

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Arthur, what is a rhino's horn made of?

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Buster, at what temperature does ice cream solidify?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) Here, I'm suddenly not hungry.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: No tougher teacher has been discovered this side of the planet, Neptune.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Aw, sometimes I wish Mr. Ratburn would just disappear.

Text: ) Arthur's Substitute Teacher Trouble

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hi.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Now class... ) Excuse me, I have a tickle in my throat. Plot to the latitude and longitude of Ulan Bator (clears throat again).

Speaker: Miss Sweetwater:
Text: Everyone, close your eyes.

Speaker: Miss Sweetwater:
Text: Now, find your nose.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Ahem... Arthur, do you have a headache?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Do I? ) I mean, no.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: After lunch, we'll review last night's math... ) homework. (He waves the students away.)

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Mr. Haney, I ---.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: What is it, man? Speak up.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: I... I can't do... the class, I...

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Now, what did you say?

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Ratburn, I hate to tell this, but I think you're losing your voice.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Whatever you wanted to tell me will just have to wait until you're feeling better.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Children, I have some bad news.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) He's gonna say we have to go to school all summer, I know it!

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Mr. Ratburn is ill and will be out for the rest of the week.

Speaker: Students:
Text: YAY!!!!

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: You may use this time to do homework while I arrange for a substitute teacher.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: ) RAWWRR!!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: ) Do you think the substitute will be Mr. Elkin again?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I hope not!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Mr. Elkin, is this right?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Whoa!

Speaker: Mr. Elkin:
Text: Oh, sorry.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: ) Ugh.

Speaker: Buster ):
Text: Mr. Elkin wasn't as bad as Mrs. Bofini.

Speaker: Mrs. Bofini:
Text: Spell leather.

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: The WORST substitute teacher was Ms. Tremello!

Speaker: Buster ):
Text: Who mumbled everything.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: What did she say?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I dunno. Your ears are bigger than mine.

Text: The best of all was Ms. Blank.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Who?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Don't you remember Ms. Blank?

Text: Your substitute teacher, Ms. Blank, is unable to come in, so have fun coloring today. I'll be by later with some snacks.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Ah, Ms. Blank.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Who's our substitute? Ms. Blank?

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Good news. Your substitute will be Mr. Ratburn's own sister, Ms. Ratburn!

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: I'm sure she'll be just as much fun as Mr. Ratburn.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Maybe Ratburn's sister will look nothing like him at all!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What are the chances of that? They grew up in the same house, Arthur!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh yeah...

Speaker: Francine ):
Text: I bet even when they were babies, they were Ratburns.

Speaker: Toddler Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Hey, can you spell "antediluvian"?

Speaker: Toddler Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Of course. Can't you? Now stop bothering me. I'm doing calculus.

Speaker: Francine ):
Text: And that's just when they were babies. When they got older...

Speaker: Eight-Year-Old Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Are you having nails for breakfast again?

Speaker: Eight-Year-Old Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Of course. Want some?

Speaker: Eight-Year-Old Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Milk?

Speaker: Eight-Year-Old Ms. Ratburn:
Text: No, I eat my nails without milk.

Speaker: Eight-Year-Old Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Is that a screw? I'll take it. They're the best part.

Speaker: Francine ):
Text: And imagine them in college.

Speaker: College Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Here. Even though your teacher gave you a perfect grade on your final, I found a mistake he missed. I informed your teacher, and he's lowering your grade.

Speaker: College Ms. Ratburn:
Text: ) Oh really? Well, you know that new star you discovered? I checked and for your edification, it was just gas. I notified the observatory. They're taking your name off the Honor Roll.

Speaker: College Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Why must you compete with me? You know I'm smarter.

Speaker: College Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Are not!

Speaker: College Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Am too!

Speaker: College Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Are not, not, not!

Speaker: College Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Am too, too, too!

Speaker: College Ms. Ratburn:
Text: ) You sound like a train.

Speaker: College Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Who invented little sisters, anyway?! I'll show you! One day I'll be the TOUGHEST TEACHER IN THE UNIVERSE!

Speaker: Arthur, Buster, and Francine:
Text: ) Aww, great!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Maybe it's not too late to change schools.

Speaker: David:
Text: I don't know how I'm gonna get all this work done tomorrow.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I could stay home from school and help you.

Speaker: David:
Text: No thanks, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Can I stay home from school tomorrow?

Speaker: David:
Text: Are you sick?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: No. I should help you with your work. I don't want you to lose the business. I'm thinking of Kate's future.

Speaker: David:
Text: Arthur, come on. School can't be that bad.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You have no idea.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I've got a plan. If she's anything like her brother, I'm getting sent home with a stomachache.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Maybe I'll lose my glasses at lunch and get sent home.

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Good morning, class. I'm Ms. Rodentia Ratburn. My brother has filled me in on everything.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Get ready to work like dogs!

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Well, let's not waste any time. Everyone together, let's recite the one times table. Begin.

Speaker: Class:
Text: One times one is one. One times two is two. One times three is three...

Speaker: Francine:
Text: The one times table? Does she think we are babies?!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Who cares? It's easy.

Speaker: Class:
Text: One times six is six. One times seven is seven...

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: What color do yellow and blue make?

Speaker: Class:
Text: Green!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: This is the easiest day of school ever!

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Okay, everyone, read this word.

Speaker: Class:
Text: ) Dog.

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Good! Good! Now for something a bit more difficult.

Speaker: Class:
Text: ) Cat.

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: ) “I like fudge, I like fudge. If you ask me what I like, I say I like fudge.”

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Shocking!

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: And what season comes after fall?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Winter...

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: You're right! Hooray!

Speaker: Brain:
Text: For goodness sake, we're in third grade, you know!

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: You mean this work is too easy?

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Uh-huh.

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: Then let's do the two times table. Everyone: Two times one...

Speaker: Class:
Text: Is two. Two times two is four. Two times three is six. Two times four is eight...

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: This is the longest day of my life. Is it time to go home yet?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: It's only ten o'clock... a.m.

Speaker: Class:
Text: Two times eight is sixteen. Two times nine is eighteen.

Speaker: Class:
Text: Two times ten is twenty.

Speaker: Sue Ellen:
Text: Ah!

Speaker: Class:
Text: Two times eleven is twenty-two.

Speaker: Class:
Text: Two times twelve is twenty four.

Speaker: Class:
Text: Two times thirteen is twenty-six. Two times fourteen is...

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Aaaah!

Speaker: Ms. Ratburn:
Text: ) My, where has the time gone?! What a wonderful day! I don't believe in giving homework, so rest your brains. Tomorrow we'll all read aloud from “Spotty goes a-counting”.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Don't panic. Just get home to your computer. Hurry! hurry!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: "My Sister Is A Sissy" by Jack Prelutsky.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Only two days until the library poetry contest and only one student has signed up: Fern.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Fern never said she wrote poetry.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Fern never says anything.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: The judge is famous poet Jack Prelutsky. It's not too late to enter.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Listen, I'm a poet. Moon, June, spoon, a loon...

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Just thinking of poetry, oh, it makes me sleepy.

Speaker: Rattles:
Text: Binky, know what's twice as boring as a poem?

Speaker: Binky:
Text: What?

Speaker: Rattles:
Text: Two poems.

Speaker: Fern:
Text: You only make fun because you couldn't write a poem if you tried.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: That's the most she's said all year.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You tell ‘em, Fern! )

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Maybe I couldn’t write a poem, but neither could they.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I could if I wanted to.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Me too. No problem.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: I can write a better poem than you with my brain tied behind my back, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Ha! Oh yeah? I’d like to see that.

Speaker: Kids:
Text: Ow! Ow!

Speaker: Fern:
Text: I bet none of you could even write a poem.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I could too.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Maybe Binky can’t, but I can.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: There’s nothing Arthur can do that I can’t.

Text: You are so rude, Fern.

Text: Someone hold me back or I’ll write a poem right now.

Text: QUIET!! A car alarm goes off. I bet that none of you can write a poem and finish it in time to submit it to the poetry contest.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I bet I can!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I’ll not only finish one, it will be better than Binky’s.

Text: Is anyone else hungry?

Text: Anyone who doesn’t has to join the poetry club for a year. Bet, or are you bunch of chickens?

Text: ): How do you write a poem?

Text: I thought you knew.

Text: I don’t want to go to poetry club for a whole year.

Text: It’ll be a cinch. We just find a good poem and write one like it. ) “The time has come, the walrus said, to talk of many things / of shoes and ships and sealing-wax, of cabbages and kings / and why the sea is boiling hot, and whether pigs have wings.” No, I don't think I can write like that.

Text: Let's find one that makes sense.

Text: I'm done too. "My favorite thing to do is shop / for shoes, shirts, coats, rings..." You can never have enough jewellery. “...and games until I drop. / I love to shop.”

Text: I know a great poem: “Roses are red / violets are blue / my nose smells / and your feet do too”. ) That's so funny! Doesn't that crack you up, Arthur? Arthur walks up the stairs looking depressed. Arthur?

Text: Books? Who cares about books?

Text: Joe Fallon --- Storyboard by: J.O'Neill & I. Tankushev

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Ya-Hoo!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Am I the only one whose brain hurts?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) The last time I saw this many numbers in a row, I was paying for a broken window out of my allowance.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Who has the answer? Buster?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) You'd better get it right.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) I-Is it z-zero?

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Correct.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) Ah, I thought I was I gonna die.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Don't forget, your book reports are due tomorrow morning.

Speaker: Fern:
Text: What are you writing your book report on, Arthur?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I've read a lot of good books lately. I'm trying to choose between the two best.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: If you can't decide, I've read an exciting book about magnetic fields that I highly recommend.

Speaker: Fern:
Text: No thanks, it can't be as good as "The Case of the Creepy Shadow." )

Speaker: Brain:
Text: What about you, Buster? ) It's intriguing reading and comes with six free magnets.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Um, sounds great, Brain, but I plan to do what I always do. Book reports are no sweat.

Speaker: Fern:
Text: ) "Only one thing could've set the horses free..." (beat) "The creepy shadow..."

Speaker: Brain:
Text: ) "Opposites attract." (He slides one of the magnet closer to the other. The two magnets click together on their opposite poles) "This has been proven by scientific research performed in my room."

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Ten more minutes, Mom! I have to finish this book report!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You look tired.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) I had to get up extra early to finish my book report. Didn't you do one? (pulls out his book report paper from his backpack)

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) Of course I did.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Here it is.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) "Pa-Kanong: Creature With The Big Face". (takes it out of Buster's hands) I wish I read that. Can I borrow it?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) I... don't... think so.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Why not? I've returned everything I ever borrowed from you. Even that gum.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I can't loan it to you.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: "Pa-Kanong"... Hey! I saw that on the Giant Monster Channel last night. ) Big, ugly, misunderstood. I cried.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Buster! Is that why you can't loan your book to me? You did your book report about a movie?!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) So? That's how I do all my book reports. All movies come from books.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: They don't? Uh-oh!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) Be a book. Please, be a book.

Speaker: Ms. Turner:
Text: Sorry. No book called "Pa-Kanong: Creature With The Big Face" was ever published. But it was a movie in 1957. Would you like the video?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) No thank you.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: This is a tragedy.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: What are you gonna do?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) My dad's a pilot. Maybe he could fly me out of the country. (goes back to hopeless mode) No. Mom's making my favorite dinner tonight. (Sits down on the curb, pulling down his ears) Ratburn will give me an "F" for sure.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Knowing Ratburn, probably "F minus." Maybe even a "G" or an "H."

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I guess I should tell Mr. Ratburn before class, so everyone doesn't have to watch me flunk. )

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) You sure you want to go through with this?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: It's a far, far better thing to do than it would be to cry and run home.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Did he give you an "F"?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: No. He said that if I hand in a report on a real book by Friday, I won't get penalized.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: That's great!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Something weird is going on. Buster put down his fork and there's still food on his plate.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Why are you sad? All you have to do is read a book by Friday.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur, I have a confession to make. I've never read a whole book in my entire life.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Sure you did.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Nope.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Yes you did.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: No!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: What about the Scare-Your-Pants-Off books we all read?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) I watched the TV show. (He slumps on the table and moans guiltily, while Arthur, Francine, and Brain look on in surprise)

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Whatever book Buster reads for this report will be the first book he's ever read. He needs suggestions.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: ) This "Molecular Theorem" book changed my life forever.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: It's his first book. Go easy. My first book was, "Ponies Go to Paris".

Speaker: Arthur, Buster, and Brain:
Text: ) Yuck!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: ) Well, it can't be anything too hard. I tried to read something hard and didn't read anything else for a long time because it was hard.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Molecules are very small. Small things are easy.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Molecules are NOT easy!

Speaker: Fern:
Text: Forget science.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I can't even spell "molecules".

Speaker: Fern:
Text: Hey, "Sherlock Holmes".

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: I have the answer: Short books.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Simple.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Very, very short books.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) HEY! (to Buster as he hands him a book) Here. Take the latest Scare-Your-Pants-Off book. You'll like it.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) "Curse of the Jumping Peanut."

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: See, you're reading it already.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: So how did you like the book?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I-I only got up to page 2.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: ) I told you it should be easier.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: That's an easier book. "Sam and the Sandwich Company."

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Read it right here. Don't move until you're done.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) "The sun was shining the morning that Sam won a tour...

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) "...of the spectacular sandwich factory."

Speaker: Man:
Text: You lucky boy, you found the golden sandwich. And get to see my sand witches, and sandwiches.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Yeah? Well, I found a golden sandwich by biting it and broke off all my teeth.

Speaker: Man:
Text: ) But you won all the real sandwichs you can eat.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: But I can't chew them! Do you have a soup factory? I'm starving.

Speaker: Trolls:
Text: When you break off all your teeth, it becomes so hard to eat.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Aw, I'm so hungry.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Buster?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: ) At least he made it to page 3.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Buster, why did you stop reading?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I can't read that book. It makes me too hungry.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: It was too hard. We need an easier book.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: "The Jolly Jollisters"?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) "The mysterious ink stain..."

Speaker: Bud:
Text: This is a mystery that we must solve.

Speaker: Sister:
Text: Yes, Bud. We must.

Speaker: Father:
Text: How could this ink stain be on our couch when we Jollisters only write with pencils?

Speaker: Dog:
Text: Woof, woof!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Could you guys keep it down? I'm trying to watch TV.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, no, he gave up again!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Even that was too hard!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I know you can read this one.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Just force yourself to keep reading.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) I'll try.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) "A car with no driver climbed into my room and said, 'Let me drive you to Afkaphazoom.' The Bongogaremers waved as we passed. Downhill we went slow and uphill we went fast. Oobers, Baringsters, and a piece of the moon asked to come along to Afkaphazoom. I said, 'Let me out! There is not enough room and I don't care to go to Afkaphazoom!'"

Speaker: Piece of the Moon:
Text: Why did we stop?

Speaker: Baringster ):
Text: Well, nothing happens if no one's reading the book.

Speaker: The Talking Car:
Text: And it was just getting exciting.

Speaker: The Boy:
Text: Well, I didn't want to go anyway.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: He stopped reading.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) How can my best friend not like reading?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) You don't know all the great stuff you're missing by not reading.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: So I'm not a reader. I'll just become rich and pay the Brain to do that simple stuff for me.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: ) I think I might be too busy discovering new planets to read to you, Buster!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Here's a book anyone can finish.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) What's that other book?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) "Robin Hood." If you really work at it, someday you can read a book like this.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Cool!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: "The sky is blue. The ocean is blue."

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I can't do it!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Wait a minute.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: So, you finished it?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Not really.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Buster, you're gonna flunk!!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) I couldn't finish because I was too tired from reading this. I'm almost done. It was so exciting I couldn't stop.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You read that much of "Robin Hood"? Hey, you can't be a faster reader than I am! You never read!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I guess the problem was, I just wasn't reading anything I really liked. I mean, "Blue"? Come on.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Is it okay that my report has a cliffhanger ending?

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) Next time, start reading when you're supposed to and you'll be able to finish the book.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: So, I don't flunk?

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) No.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I can't wait to read the next chapter of "Robin Hood".

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Me neither. Let's do it now!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, wow, this is great! You done with this page yet?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Almost. Hold it. Okay, turn.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: This is the best book I ever read.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I thought it was the first.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: That too.

Speaker: Friar Buster:
Text: Oh, I’ve got to go. See ya!

Speaker: Arthur Hood:
Text: Ahhh!

Speaker: Mrs. Read:
Text: This package came in the mail for you, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I want more icing on the cakes and more cream in the custard. He faces the camera. Hello. I'm Arthur Read and I just had my eighteenth birthday. I'm now an adult. I'm the president of a catering business.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Mmm! It needs more sugar.

Speaker: Chef:
Text: Yes, Mr. Read.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I like my job. Arthur drives a big limousine. Of course, I have a chauffeur, but sometimes I like to drive.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I also do the shopping for dinner.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Yes, sir! Life's been good to me. I have a nice house... and a great son.

Speaker: Arthur's son:
Text: Hi, Daddy! I love you. Mom! Daddy's home!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Mom?!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hi, honey. How about a hug and a big kiss?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Aaahhh! It's nightmares like that that make me never want to grow up.

Speaker: Francine ):
Text: Arthur and the Square Dance.

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Swing you partner round and round. That's it. Keep swinging. Do-si-do.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Binky, not so fast!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Side couples up to the middle... High five.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Aah!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey, watch it!

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: It's not my fault! Binky threw me!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: You too! Front and back and up to the middle, and then scoot back.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Binky, what are you waiting for?

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Huh? Oh.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Uh-oh.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: This is such a dumb dance!

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Arthur, next time it rains, and we have square-dancing, would you be my partner?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey, wait a second! Then who's going to be my partner?

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Hey! Stupid shoelace.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Sorry, Muffy. Arthur's only dancing with me! Come on, Arthur. I'll give you a lift home.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Hm! You'd think they were married or something!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Something smells rotten about this. You don't think Arthur and Francine...?

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Oh please! It's so obvious! Next time it rains, you'll see who's dancing with who.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Wow! I guess Arthur and Francine are... in love! I think I'm going to be sick!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Hi, Binky.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Hey, lover-boy! Where's your girlfriend?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: My what??

Speaker: Binky:
Text: You know - her middle name is Alice and she's a girl.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You mean Muffy?

Speaker: Binky:
Text: No, doofus, Francine! Sheesh! You don't even know your own girlfriend?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Francine is not my girlfriend!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Oh, don't worry. Your little secret is safe with me.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hm!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: “Arthur and Francine sitting in a tree K-I-S-N-I...” Wait a minute. K-S- Oh... Oh, well. You know what I mean!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Francine and me?! Hahaha! What a joke!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Francine! You want to hear something really funny? Binky thinks...

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hold on, Arthur. I've got a surprise for you. She takes two cowboy hats out of her locker. I found them in our basement.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Cool.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I thought we could wear them next time there's a square dance. She puts one hat on Arthur and one on her own head. Care to dance, partner?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I'd be right proud, ma'am.

Speaker: Arthur+Francine:
Text: “Swing your partner round and round. Elbow left and promenade home.”

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey, Arthur, what do you want to tell me?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Ah... It's not important. I'll tell you later.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: See you on the field.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey, Muffy, I've got to break in my new mitt. You want to use my old one for today's game? It's the best!

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Wow! The glove that won last year's championship. Too bad my hand's too small.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Oh well, give it to Arthur. Maybe he'll catch something today.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Binky, I'm telling you, nothing is going on between Francine and me!

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Oh, Arthur! I almost forgot. Francine wants you to wear her mitt. Here!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Wow! The glove that won last year's championship! Francine would never part with this, unless... No way! She could never be in love with...

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Uh-oh! Arthur!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Ready out there, Arthur?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Or could she?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Ah! Well, Arthur, what's this big secret that you couldn't tell me in front of the others?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Um, Francine...

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey, are you going to finish that?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Go ahead. He pushes his lemonade to her. You don't...like... er... Binky and Brain are standing in front of the window. Arthur yells out in shock.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I don't like what, Arthur?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Nothing. Forget I ever said anything. I got to go.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What's gotten into him?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) Arthur, that's the funniest thing I've ever heard!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: That's what I thought, Buster. But then she wants us to wear matching cowboy hats, for me to use her mitt, and... I don't know what's next.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Look, all I can tell you is you'd better keep away from her.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: How can I keep away from her? Francine is one of my best friends!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur, what if she tries to kiss you?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: What?!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: That's what girls do when they like you. Arthur? Are you okay, Arthur?

Speaker: Doctor:
Text: Mr. and Mrs. Read, I'm afraid I have some... bad news. Your son has...cooties!

Speaker: Mrs. Read:
Text: Ah! My baby!

Speaker: Doctor:
Text: Be careful!

Speaker: Doctor:
Text: He's highly contagious!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur! Hey!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey, Arthur!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Aagh!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: How's it going?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Fine. Great. Super.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Is something wrong? You've been acting kind of strange lately.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Strange? No. Why would you think that?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Well, for one thing, you're about to go into the girls' bathroom.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Ah- Hehe! Just...just kidding! Just a joke.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Weird.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Arthur! Over here!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Hi! My name's Arthur.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hey! I was saving you a seat!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, er, thanks, Francine, but I thought I would, er... The Tough Customers ignore him. ...meet some new kids today.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Hmph! Fine! See if I care!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Ha, she's a friend. Not a girlfriend or anything like that. Just a friend who's also a girl and we're definitely not in love, ha-ha.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Arthur!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Whoa!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I want to talk to you.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Er... er... He tags her. Tag! You're it!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Prunella. Arthur's acting really weird around me.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Like how?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Well, I just tried to talk to him, and he ran away.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Hmm. Tell me something. Do his cheeks go red when you're near him?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Yeah!

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: And does he talk l-l-l-like th-th-th- this?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Yeah! Just like that.

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Francine, I hate to say this, but I think Arthur's in love with you.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What?! That's ridiculous! Nah!

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: I'm sorry, Francine, but those are all signs of major love disease.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: That's the grossest thing I've ever heard! What do I do?

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: You have to let him know that you don't love him. But be very careful what you say. You could break his heart. )

Speaker: Francine:
Text: You're right. I'll have to be gentle with him.

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Arthur! Francine! I bet you two pokes are excited for a little hootenanny this afternoon!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Huh? But we only have square-dancing when it rains!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Yeah, and it's really sunny out!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Oh, it's going to rain, all right. My elbow's acting up, and it only does that when a storm's a coming.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Huh?

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Yup. Catgut doesn't lie!

Speaker: Arthur+Francine:
Text: Augh!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Arthur, I think...

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ...we shouldn't dance...

Speaker: Francine:
Text: ...with each other.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Right?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Right.

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Okay, cowboys and cowgirls, let's see how much you remember from last week's hoedown. The music starts. Bow to your corner... and bow to your partner.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Ow! Binky!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Sorry!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Now, everybody, promenade.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Arthur, we're falling behind! Pay attention!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Now, thread the needle!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Francine, quit trying to dance with me!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Me trying to dance with you? You're trying to dance with me!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Francine, do I have to spell it out for you?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Don't make me say it, Arthur.

Speaker: Arthur+Francine:
Text: I'm not in love with you! They stare at each other while the others pass through the needle.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: You mean, don't have a crush on me?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: No way! And you, you don't want to kiss me?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Are you kidding? I'd rather have head lice!

Speaker: Arthur+Francine:
Text: break apart Eugh!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Okay, everybody, grab your partners!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Phew! I'm glad that's over!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Francine, let's never let a silly thing like love come between us again.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: You said it, partner!

Speaker: Mrs. McGrady:
Text: Side couples right and left and through. Side ladies' chain across. All join up hands and circle left.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Haha! You're it!

Speaker: Prunella:
Text: Oh, no!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Sometimes I wonder what the world would be like if everyone was just like me.

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: No one would call anyone Four Eyes.

Speaker: Arthur 1:
Text: Hey, nice glasses!

Speaker: Arthur 2:
Text: Thanks. Yours are pretty cool too.

Speaker: Arthurs:
Text: Hooray! Hooray! Hooray! Hooray! Hooray! Hooray!

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: My birthday would be a national holiday.

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: And all the people would be super nice - even the bank robbers.

Speaker: Arthur the Robber:
Text: Good morning, everyone. Would you be so kind as to give me all your money?

Speaker: Arthur 1:
Text: Certainly, sir.

Speaker: Arthur 2:
Text: My pleasure.

Speaker: Arthur the Dad:
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Did not!

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Well, you heard him. And he's the biggest clown in town.

Speaker: Francine:
Text: I heard about another kid once who had no sense of humor, and he grew up to be Mr. Ratburn.

Speaker: Fern+Francine+Muffy:
Text: ) Run! Run for your life! Get away from us! Aah!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Poor guy. I hope you're happy.

Speaker: Muffy: You
Text: You know, Francine, when I really think about it, I am.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Arthur looks so funny. He's in a suit.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Listen to all those mistakes he's making! Ah.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Listen to those laughs!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Wow, we must be really good.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Let's take a bow.

Speaker: Brain:
Text: Um, they're laughing at him.

Speaker: Muffy:
Text: Arthur, cut that out right now!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, sorry. I was playing with Kate.

Speaker: Mr. Read:
Text: Bravo! Encore! Bravo! Bravo!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: What are you doing? They like it. Arthur, keep going.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I can't believe everybody liked what I did.

Speaker: D.W.:
Text: Neither can I. You do it every day. Big deal.

Speaker: Pickles:
Text: Congratulations, kid. Shake.

Speaker: Pickles:
Text: Woo! ) What works for me didn't work for you, so you found your own individual way to do it.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Yeah. How did I do that?

Speaker: Pickles:
Text: Just because there's one way to do something doesn't mean that it's the only way. Everybody's got a different style. Don't be afraid to find yours.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I'll remember that Mr. Pickles.

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: “So Francine was wrong. I was funny. I just hadn't found my style yet.”

Speaker: Arthur ):
Text: "Now, if only I could find a style that would get me an A in math. Write back soon. Your friend, Arthur."

Speaker: SUE ELLEN'S LOST DIARY: Written by Peter K. Hirsch, Storyboard by Ivan Tankushev
Text: Written by Peter K. Hirsch, Storyboard by Ivan Tankushev

Speaker: Heart:
Text: Hello there, allow me to introduce myself. I'm Arthur's heart. I'm the guy who pumps blood through Arthur's body.

Speaker: Lungs:
Text: Hey, we late?

Speaker: Heart:
Text: No, come on. These are Arthur's lungs.

Speaker: Lungs:
Text: ) Hey!

Speaker: Heart:

Text: Mr. Haney, sir, every minute of life is a precious gift. We live in a world surrounded by beauty. Outside Mr. Frensky drives away the garbage truck to reveal a view of a beautiful forest. Should we fritter away our lives and allow the wonders of this amazing gift to just pass us by?

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Come with me, young man.

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: Mr. Ratburn, this boy has the soul of a poet and I for one do not appreciate you trying to crush his soaring spirit and natural talents.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Binky?? Binky Barnes??

Speaker: Mr. Haney:
Text: This budding Walt Whitman has inspired me to follow my lifelong dream to climb Mount Everest. I won't be a life fritterer-awayer. Thank you, my boy!

Text: See you, Herb.

Text: I realise these are your life's goals, but you just can't take a bite out of the sun. It's hotter than pizza that's been cooked inside a baked potato. You'd melt.

Text: And you can't drink a whole ocean. Salt water would make you sick.

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: ) I was gonna give you an F, but that joke...! You deserve a higher grade!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: My joke got him that B plus! Ow!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Great shot, Buster! Aren't you happy you won the game for us?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Binky told my joke!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Why do you keep telling us?! Why don't you talk to Binky about it!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You think I won't?! Just watch me! He walks up to Binky. Hey, Binky!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Yeah?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Did you tell him?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Have you ever noticed how large he is? I'll never get payback for that joke!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Whoa!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: ) I feel better already! Now he'll know how it feels to be embarrassed!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: What's wrong?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Everyone's laughing, just like when he told the joke. Everyone thinks Binky's funny.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: So what if people think he's funny?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Binky doesn't care about funny. It's me who cares about funny. It's me who memorizes joke books and practices making faces in the mirror! He makes a funny face at Francine. I have to work at it. You know how long I worked on that King Tut joke?

Speaker: Francine:
Text: A lot longer than you worked on your report!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Yeah, but Binky... He puts a whole banana in his mouth. Haven't you noticed that anything he does seems kind of...funny?

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You're spending way too much time thinking about Binky.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: It won't matter after the talent show tomorrow. I'll show him! He'll be sorry he stole my joke.

Speaker: Sue Ellen:
Text: Hi-ya-ah! Hi-ya!

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: Thank you, Sue Ellen, for that demonstration of... pumpkin kicking. And now the comedy stylings of Buster Baxter!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: At least while he's telling jokes, Buster won't be talking about Binky!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I think he's gotten over it.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Hi, everyone. There's a kid in my class named Binky Barnes.

Speaker: Arthur+Francine:
Text: Oh, no!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Nobody has a bad thing to say about Binky, because they don't want to get pounded. Binky wrote a history report about Columbus. Columbus, that's Italian for "Boy, am I lost!" I wrote a report about King Tut and I wrote a good King Tut joke to open my report with, but Binky told my King Tut joke in his Columbus report. Everybody laughed. But you know what the punch line was? He told my joke that I wrote and I got a D!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: I don't get it.

Speaker: Rattles:
Text: I think it's a pun.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Well, it wasn't very punny. Haha, punny! )

Speaker: Mr. Ratburn:
Text: And the winner is...George!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I can't believe I didn't win!

Speaker: Francine:
Text: Win?! You didn't tell a single joke!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: That was the comedy of truth. All the greats do it. Oh, I should have just told jokes. This is all Binky's fault!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I don't think Buster's ever gonna stop holding this grudge against Binky!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Wow, our first day of college, Buster! Isn't it exciting?!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Binky's not here, is he? He told my joke! It was a good joke.

Speaker: Announcer:
Text: Ladies and gentlemen, the President of the United States.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Binky told my joke. It was in Mr. Ratburn's third-grade class, and he... )

Speaker: Woman:
Text: Oh, dear.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: He told my joke! It was a good King Tut joke!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: ) Arthur hits the ball in the water. Oh! (growls)

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Buster! You can't stay mad at Binky forever! It doesn't do any good!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Yes, it does! If I keep it up, I'll make sure Binky gets a D and is totally miserable all the time!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: That's exactly what's happening to you! Don't you see how holding a grudge is only hurting you! You've been mad since Binky told the joke!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Arthur, I know what you're trying to say.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You do?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You're saying, the only way I could be happy is if Binky never told that joke in the first place.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Yeah, and it's too late for that.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: So, to stop him, I must travel back through time and change the past.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: What??

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I need a time machine. Or a rocket that can travel faster than light speed around the sun.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: You can't change the past, Buster!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Oh, can't, can't I?!

Speaker: Brain:
Text: You can't change the past, Buster.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Oh, rats!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: I understand how you feel, Buster. I was mad when I didn't get a green ice-cream cake for my fourth birthday.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Yeah?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: That's silly! Staying mad all the time won't get you what you want.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: It's just that, after all the work I did on that report, Binky ruined it!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: That's not my fault! They put it right next to Egypt in the encyclopedia! I guess it was my fault. I deserve a D. Binky rides over the bridge on roller skates. Binky! Hey!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Whoa!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: I just wanted to tell you I'm not mad anymore.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: You were mad?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Yeah, about you stealing my joke.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: What joke?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: What does King Tut say when he gets scared? I want my mummy!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: ) That's funny! I think I've heard it before, though.

Speaker: Buster:
Text: You heard it when you stole it from me and told the class!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: When somebody tells you a joke, you're supposed to tell it to someone else, right?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: But I made it up for my report and then you used it without asking! That's like stealing!

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Oh, I didn't mean to steal it. Here's, um... He empties his pocket. ...seventy... seventy-three cents and a sticker of a cool car and a button. He gives them to Buster. That's all I have. Sorry!

Speaker: Buster:
Text: He gave me seventy-three cents, a sticker of a cool car and a button for my joke. I got paid for writing a joke! I'm a professional! Woohoo! He runs after Binky. With your being naturally funny and me making up good jokes, I bet we can really go places.

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Like my own TV show?

Speaker: Buster:
Text: Sure. You and me and Arthur...

Speaker: Binky:
Text: Us, maybe. But I don't think Arthur. Who'd want to watch him on TV?

Text: But father, it's only eight o'clock! Can't I discover one more moon of Jupiter? Please?

Text: It's always one more moon of Jupiter, and before you know it, it's the whole Milky Way! You've got the entire renaissance to discover the moons of Jupiter, Gali. It's past your bedtime. Now get into your jammies, please!

Text: Aw...

Text: Ow!

Text: Stop moping around! Do you expect ideas to fall from the sky?

Text: Whoa! This fair is so cool! It's just like being in the Middle Ages.

Text: Stick with your partner and take notes on all the historical details. They'll be useful when we compete in the games.

Text: Get your haggis here! Fresh haggis! Two for a dollar!

Text: There it is - the Golden Gryphon, the award given to the class which exhibits the greatest knowledge of medieval history.

Text: Boy! Mr. Ratburn sure wants to win that Golden Gryphon!

Text: We came so close to winning last year. If we all try our hardest, I'm sure this is the year we finally win.

Text: I bet we can win, because what class on Earth does as much homework or works as hard as we do.

Text: "Glenbrook! Glenbrook! That's our school! Glenbrook! Glenbrook! We will rule! Go, Glenbrook!"

Text: It can't be!

Text: Ah, Ratburn! We meet again.

Text: Mr. Pryce-Jones, my old teacher! I didn't know you were still at the Glenbrook Academy?

Text: They won't let me quit. After all, I am irreplaceable.

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Huh...?

Text: Oh, no!

Text: Bath, Sienna, Avignon, we've won all the medieval fairs in Europe. This little one should be a snap.

Text: Excuse me, sir, but it's ten-fourteen.

Text: Well, time to prepare. See you at Merlin's Labyrinth, Ratburn. Don't get lost along the way! )

Text: Have we ever played soccer against those guys? They seem kind of familiar.

Text: The first to escape a point shall win, the other one shall perish within.

Text: Remember, Chester, navigate by the sun and the tops of the trees.

Text: Arthur, use your head.

Text: On your mark, get set, hie thee hence. Chester runs into the maze. That means “go”, kid!

Speaker: Arthur:
Text: Oh, no! Dead end! He sees his shadow on a wall. Hmm! My shadow! ) Oh! He falls backwards through the maze’s cloth wall. He gets up and rubs his head. I guess I really used my head.

Text: He or she who pulls the sword from the stone truly is our king or queen. 'Tis an equal opportunity sword. Keep the line moving! Arthur goes to the sword. All your might won't set things right. ‘Tis a gentle hand will rule the land.

Text: Arthur! Everyone's looking for you! We lost at Merlin's Maze. Time for the next competition.

Text: Quick, lads and lasses! V = u + a t. Now!

Text: ...but Mr. Pryce-Jones made us learn Latin in third grade.

Text: Sum, es, est, sumus, estis, sunt. [I am, you are, he/she is, we are, you are, they are.]

Text: Again!

Text: Sum, es, est, sumus, estis, sunt.

Text: Hup! Hup! Hup! Hup! ...

Text: I learned a lot. It makes me wonder sometimes if I'm not a tough enough teacher.
